tool_calls.input_summary: {"title": "Add \"crush:ignore\" label to issue taxonomy", "body": "New label `crush:ignore` -- never added by default. The only way it can be applied is when a `/crush` skill run defers work to `/task...

input_full.title: Add "crush:ignore" label to issue taxonomy
input_full.body:
New label `crush:ignore` -- never added by default. The only way it can be applied is when a `/crush` skill run defers work to `/task`. When that happens, Claude Code should ask the user whether to tag the issue with `crush:ignore`, signaling future crush runs to skip it.

**Workflow:**
1. `/crush` identifies an issue to work on
2. `/crush` determines the issue should be deferred (too complex, blocked, etc.)
3. Claude Code asks: "Tag this issue with `crush:ignore` so future crush runs skip it?"
4. If yes, label is applied to the issue

No other pathway adds this label.

---
Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
